sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action updates an existing group in Box account of the associated credentials.

Inputs:

  • Group ID - The group ID of an existing group in box.
  • Name - The name of the group to be updated in Box.
  • Group Origin/Group Provenance - Used to identity the external source where the group is coming from. E.g. ServiceNow or Google etc.
  • Group Identifier - A group identifier for groups coming from external sources. E.g. ServiceNow Box users or Google Box Users.
  • Description - A description that defines the group and its purpose.
  • Invitation Preferences - Specifies who can invite this group to folders.
    • Admins Only - Primary Admin, Co-admins, the group's Group Admin can invite this group to folders.
    • Admins and Members - Only Admins listed and group members can provide access to folders.
    • All Managed Users - All managed users can provide this group access to folders.
  • Group Members Visibility - Specifies who can view the members of this group.
    • Admins Only - Primary Admin, Co-admins, the group's Group Admin can view members in this group.
    • Admins and Members - Only Admins listed and group members can view other members in this group.
    • All Managed Users - All managed users can view members in this group.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.
  • Group ID - ID of the group in box.
  • Group Info - Information of the updated group in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Group Details - Information of the updated group.
    • ID
    • Name
    • Type
    • Group Type

Error Messages:

  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • Group with given ID not found.
  • Group with the same name already exists.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.

Additional Notes:

  • Box only supports group names of 255 characters or less. Names that will not be supported are the name “none” or a null name.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action updates an existing group in Box account of the associated credentials.

Inputs:

  • Group ID - The group ID of an existing group in box.
  • Name - The name of the group to be updated in Box.
  • Group Origin/Group Provenance - Used to identity the external source where the group is coming from. E.g. ServiceNow or Google etc.
  • Group Identifier - A group identifier for groups coming from external sources. E.g. ServiceNow Box users or Google Box Users.
  • Description - A description that defines the group and its purpose.
  • Invitation Preferences - Specifies who can invite this group to folders.
    • Admins Only - Primary Admin, Co-admins, the group's Group Admin can invite this group to folders.
    • Admins and Members - Only Admins listed and group members can provide access to folders.
    • All Managed Users - All managed users can provide this group access to folders.
  • Group Members Visibility - Specifies who can view the members of this group.
    • Admins Only - Primary Admin, Co-admins, the group's Group Admin can view members in this group.
    • Admins and Members - Only Admins listed and group members can view other members in this group.
    • All Managed Users - All managed users can view members in this group.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.
  • Group ID - ID of the group in box.
  • Group Info - Information of the updated group in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • Group with given ID not found.
  • Group with the same name already exists.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.

Additional Notes:

  • Box only supports group names of 255 characters or less. Names that will not be supported are the name “none” or a null name.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.name: Update Group
